page.title: 01South Dalton Wold
page.content: This Wold is an example of how the relatively barren sheepwalks of the Wolds were transformed by the great land owners of the 18th & 19th centuries. The area would be rolling arable Wold as are the extremities now but for the activities of the Aislabie & Hotham families. Dalton Old Wood was so called in 1727 & still contains a proportion of Beech that were standing at that time though the bulk of the remaining woodland is Victorian in origin. Dalton Hall (block 8) is on the new site & was probably built about 1740, modernised in 1870 & then reduced in 1956 to its present but still massive brick symmetry. The old Hall stood amongst ancient enclosures which can still be picked out in the later parkland to the East of the present building.
